title: Ride to Khong's Legendary
text:
NEWSPAPER SECTION: LIFE | WRITER: KARNJANA KARNJANATAWE - + The Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT) will organise "Ride to Khong's Legendary", the road bicycle race through four provinces along the Mekong River, from Oct 29 to Nov 1. The aim is to promote sport tourism and to see the potential to organise the event as an annual international bicycle race, according to TAT chief Yuthasak Supasorn. TAT invested about 13 million baht in the event, which is expected to attract more than 1,000 participants. 
The Ride to Khong's Legendary biking competition will open for teams and individuals to compete in three stage races. The total distance is 245.9km. The first stage on will run from Nong Khai to Bung Kan with a 115.3km ride. The second stage will run from Nakhon Phanom to Mukdahan (99.2km) and the last stage will go from in the city of Mukdahan to a mountaintop of Phu Manorom (31.4km). The winner will be awarded with the Royal Trophy of His Royal Highness Crown Prince Maha Vajiralongkorn and a cash prize. Special for female riders, they will have a chance to win beauty awards for "Angel Speed", "Beauty Skin" and "Best Costume". 
Visit www.ridetokhonglegendary.com or follow the event's activity on Facebook Fanpage at www.facebook.com/ridetokhonglegendary . Travel Smart Study 
The cheapest time to book hotels is in the first two weeks of January when room rates are below average, according to Agoda.com, the hotel booking website. 
The result is part of its "Travel Smart study" which is based on booking data through its website in 2014. The study analysed hotel prices at 25 of the world's popular tourist destinations to help travellers find the best hotel deals. 
"For many travellers, price is the most important factor in deciding when and where to go. This data can help our customers get the most out of their money," said John Brown, chief operating officer of Agoda.com. 
The most expensive period for booking an accommodation is during the months of September and October. On average, a hotel room in Berlin, for example, costs 51% more in September compared to January. 
When segmented in to city destinations, mid-March is the time to visit Europe because hotel rooms in Paris, Berlin, Rome, Amsterdam, Barcelona, Stockholm and London are 20% cheaper than average. 
July is considered high season in many popular destinations, but hotel rooms in Sydney and New York are cheaper than average. The last week in December, also considered high season in most destinations, is the time to travel to Stockholm. 
In contrast to hotel room rates in Europe, the rates in Asia's popular destinations such as Bangkok, Hong Kong, Seoul and Singapore are consistent throughout the year and discounts aren't too dramatic, he noted. Airlines Update NokScoot will fly from Don Mueang Airport to Taipei, Taiwan, starting on Oct 25. The airline will operate four flights a week by Boeing 777-200, which can accommodate up to 415 passengers, 24 business class seat and 391 economy seats. 
The flight will depart from Bangkok at 11.35pm on Wednesdays, Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays while the return flights from Taipei will be 5.15am on Mondays, Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays. 
Visit www.nokscoot.com or Call Center at 02-021-0000 . Etihad Airways has awarded IBM with a 10-year technology services contract worth US$700 million (24 billion baht). 
The agreement will allow the airline to enhance guest experiences, develop world-class infrastructure and security, and improve efficiency, according to the airline president and CEO James Hogan. 
With the agreement, about 100 IT staff of the airline will be transferred to IBM. The company will establish a new cloud data centre for the airline in Abu Dhabi and will manage the entire data centre operation, including individual infrastructure services and IT helpdesks for Etihad Airways. 
In addition, both parties will create a joint technology and innovation council in Abu Dhabi to develop more personalised travel solutions using IBM's global research capabilities and the airline's industry expertise, he noted. 
The collaboration provides a global framework for technology service delivery for Etihad Airways and its Etihad Airways Partner airlines including Alitalia, airberlin, Jet Airways, Air Serbia, Air Seychelles and Etihad Regional. Hotels Update Thailand-based ONYX Hospitality Group has signed a contract with HB Group, a leading investment in Vietnam, to manage OZO Hoi An Hotel. 
The beachfront property will be located in the New Hoi An City, a multipurpose complex consisting of retail shops, restaurants and pubs, villas and residential apartments. OZO Hoi An will offer 364 rooms, a restaurant, a fitness, meeting facilities, beach pool, high speed Wi-Fi and paperless check-in and check-out service. 
"Vietnam is one of the region's fastest growing travel destinations, and we are excited to have OZO Hoi An as part of our continuing expansion plans," said ONYX Hospitality Group CEO Peter Henley. 
The hotel is scheduled to open in late 2016. Thailand's Minor Hotel Group will join investment with Themed Attractions Resorts & Hotels (TAR&H) of Malaysia to open Anantara Desaru Resort & Villas in southeast Malaysia. 
Minor will invest $58 million, accounting for 60% of the project, while TAR&H will invest the rest of the funding, or about $38 million. 
The hotel will be located in the new beachfront development in Desaru Coast and will have 103 deluxe rooms and 20 three- and four-bedroom villas. Other facilities will include restaurants and bars, two swimming pools, a lounge and observation bar, kids and teens clubs, meeting rooms, a fitness and an Anantara Spa. 
Anantara Desaru Resort & Villas will be open in 2018.
